TITLE: Steve Jobs used his vacation time to bombard Apple staffers with phone calls, says iPod's creator — here's why
SUMMARY: Former Apple vice president Tony Fadell says that even Steve Jobs was on vacation, he'd constantly call his staffers to brainstorm new ideas. Here's why.

TITLE: This flashy Bel Air mansion that was listed at $87.8 million flopped at auction — and now the seller is furious
SUMMARY: "Horrible, Horrible, Horrible!" was how the seller, who filed for Chapter 11 last year, characterized the auction results to CNBC.

TITLE: Here’s why inflation may be less costly for some retirees
SUMMARY: Annual inflation grew by 8.3% in April, but some retirees may be shielded from certain swelling costs, according to a J.P. Morgan report.

TITLE: IRS insists destruction of 30 million files of taxpayer data won't affect payers
SUMMARY: Filers won't be affected by the IRS decision to destroy 30 million so-called paper information returns, the agency said.

TITLE: Want to travel to space? In 2024, balloons might take you part of the way there
SUMMARY: Space tourism companies such as Blue Origin, Virgin Galactic and SpaceX rely on rockets. Others plan to use balloons to take travelers into the stratosphere.

TITLE: Tax professionals ‘horrified’ by IRS decision to destroy data on 30 million filers
SUMMARY: The IRS destroyed an estimated 30 million so-called paper-filed information returns in March 2021, sparking anger from the tax community.

TITLE: 'I made $245,000 in a month': This 29-year-old got rejected from 15 medical schools—now he runs a $1.5 million business
SUMMARY: After several side hustles and business attempts, 29-year-old Charlie Chang found success as a YouTube content creator. In 2021, his business brought in $1.5 million in revenue and passive income. Here's shares how he built each of his income streams.

TITLE: Mark Cuban predicts AI will dominate the future workplace: To be successful, 'you're going to have to understand it'
SUMMARY: Mark Cuban says AI will soon dominate the workforce, just like personal computers once did — and companies that understand it have a better chance of thriving.

TITLE: Op-ed:  That college degree is no longer the only path to achieving the American Dream
SUMMARY: As employers recognize that the lack of a four-year college degree doesn't mean a potential worker doesn't have value, the return on investment for university graduates is dropping.

TITLE: Why Abby Wambach interrupted an NFL quarterback at a board meeting: When you have 'the least privilege, speak up'
SUMMARY: At Loyola Marymount University's 2022 undergraduate commencement ceremony, retired U.S. soccer star Abby Wambach shared some advice on speaking up for yourself.

TITLE: Nearly 7 in 10 Americans want to live to 100, study finds. Here’s how retirement is changing
SUMMARY: Despite fears of outliving savings, most Americans still want to live longer, with 65% hoping to reach age 100, according to a study on longevity.

TITLE: Japan is set to open its doors in June, but some locals aren't happy about it
SUMMARY: Japan is preparing to reopen. But not everyone is happy about it, including some local tourists, who have enjoyed exploring a quieter version of their country.

TITLE: Bill Gates sees a 'pretty strong argument' for a global economic slowdown hitting this year — here's why
SUMMARY: Gates believes factors like Russia's war in Ukraine and pandemic fallout create a "strong argument" that the world will see an economic slowdown soon.

TITLE: Here’s why a Roth individual retirement account conversion may pay off in a down market
SUMMARY: Roth individual retirement account conversions may be cheaper during a stock market downturn. Here's what to consider before making the transfer.

TITLE: Andy Warhol's 'Marilyn' sells for $195 million, setting record for American art
SUMMARY: Andy Warhol's 1964 portrait of Marilyn Monroe sold for $195 million at Christie's Monday night, becoming the most expensive work of American art ever sold.

TITLE: Inside the $23.5 million mansion poised to smash another local record in Southern California
SUMMARY: The home's eight-figure asking price is more than double what it sold for less than six years ago.

TITLE: Worried about a recession? Here’s how to prepare your portfolio
SUMMARY: Eight in ten small business owners expect a recession this year, according to a CNBC survey. Here's how to prepare your portfolio.

TITLE: Over 60 million tax returns could be completed automatically, study shows
SUMMARY: The IRS could automate over 60 million tax returns, saving filers time and money, according to a study.

TITLE: Don't follow this 'popular belief' when planning for early retirement, says former JPMorgan portfolio manager
SUMMARY: How much should you save for early retirement? JPMorgan Chase's former head of retirement solutions shares the popular myth that holds young people back from a happy, stress-free early retirement.

TITLE: 'Financial First Aid' author: Don't feel 'guilty or ashamed' about making money mistakes
SUMMARY: Alyssa Davies recommends strategies than can get you out of financial trouble and alleviate anxiety about money along the way.

TITLE: F1 CEO sees 'great opportunity' in TV rights talks with ESPN deal due to expire
SUMMARY: The racing league's current deal with ESPN expires at the end of 2022.

TITLE: Kevin O'Leary doesn't hire 'workaholics': 'Working 25 hours a day makes you very, very unproductive'
SUMMARY: O'Leary tells CNBC Make It that when he's reviewing a pile of resumes, the last thing he wants to see is someone who spends all their time focused on work.

TITLE: Fiji seizes $300 million superyacht belonging to Russian oligarch Suleiman Kerimov
SUMMARY: The seizure of Suleiman Kerimov's superyacht is part of a broader effort to take the assets of sanctioned oligarchs as Russia invades Ukraine.

TITLE: Why Elon Musk doesn't like to follow business plans: 'These things are always wrong'
SUMMARY: Elon Musk stopped making business plans after selling his web software company Zip2 to Compaq for $307 million in 1999. Here's why.

TITLE: More wealthy investors would rather hold or add stocks than sell if markets keep sliding, survey says
SUMMARY: Wealthy investors are more likely to add to their stock holdings or shift out of certain sectors rather than sell if stocks continue to decline.

TITLE: This 35-year-old turned her eBay side hustle into a $141 million company: 'Here's the business plan I used'
SUMMARY: In 2014, Tori Gerbig quit her $35,000-per-year job to grow her e-commerce side hustle, Pink Lily. Today, she runs the $141 million company full-time with her husband. The 35-year-old entrepreneur shares the simple five-step business plan she used.

TITLE: Here’s how much cash retirees need to weather a stock market downturn
SUMMARY: With high inflation and rising interest rates, many worry about a prolonged stock market downturn. Here's how much cash retirees need to prepare.

TITLE: Miami hosts its first F1 Grand Prix this weekend, and thousands of fans are spending a ton just to be in town
SUMMARY: Miami's top hotels, restaurants and night clubs are offering high-priced packages for race-goers.

TITLE: Here’s where I bonds may work in your portfolio, according to financial advisors
SUMMARY: I bonds are currently paying 9.62% annual interest through October, which is an opportunity for a range of goals, according to financial experts.

TITLE: Getting an inheritance or winning the lottery can create serious emotional and financial challenges
SUMMARY: Coming into sudden wealth can create emotional and financial challenges for people who have not had a lot of money in their lives.
